what: Fit a Principal Curve in Arbitrary Dimension
title: Fit a Principal Curve in Arbitrary Dimension
text: Fitting principal curve data matrix arbitrary dimensions. principal curve smooth curve passing middle multidimensional dataset. package R/C++ reimplementation S/Fortran code provided Trevor Hastie, multiple performance tweaks.

title: Fit a Principal Curve in Arbitrary Dimension
text: Usage princurve demonstrated toy dataset.  principal curve can fit data follows:  See ?principal_curve information use princurve package.
code: t <- runif(100, -1, 1) x <- cbind(t, t ^ 2) + rnorm(200, sd = 0.05) colnames(x) <- c("dim1", "dim2")  plot(x) library(princurve) fit <- principal_curve(x) plot(fit); whiskers(x, fit$s, col = "gray")

title: Fit a Principal Curve in Arbitrary Dimension
text: Check news(package = "princurve") NEWS.md full list changes.

title: Deprecated functions — principal.curve
text: function deprecated, please use principal_curve project_to_curve instead.

title: Deprecated functions — principal.curve
code: principal.curve(...)  # S3 method for class 'principal.curve' lines(...)  # S3 method for class 'principal.curve' plot(...)  # S3 method for class 'principal.curve' points(...)  get.lam(...)

title: Deprecated functions — principal.curve
text: ... Catch-old parameters.

title: Fit a Principal Curve — principal_curve
text: Fit principal curve describes smooth curve passes middle data x orthogonal sense. curve non-parametric generalization linear principal component. closed curve fit (using smoother = "periodic_lowess") starting curve defaults circle, fit followed bias correction suggested Jeff Banfield.

title: Fit a Principal Curve — principal_curve
code: principal_curve(   x,   start = NULL,   thresh = 0.001,   maxit = 10,   stretch = 2,   smoother = c("smooth_spline", "lowess", "periodic_lowess"),   approx_points = FALSE,   trace = FALSE,   plot_iterations = FALSE,   ... )  # S3 method for class 'principal_curve' lines(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'principal_curve' plot(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'principal_curve' points(x, ...)  whiskers(x, s, ...)

title: Fit a Principal Curve — principal_curve
text: x matrix points arbitrary dimension. start either previously fit principal curve, else matrix points row order define starting curve. missing NULL, first principal component used.  smoother "periodic_lowess", circle used start. thresh convergence threshold shortest distances curve. maxit maximum number iterations. stretch stretch factor endpoints curve, allowing curve grow avoid bunching end. Must numeric value 0 2. smoother choice smoother. default "smooth_spline", choices "lowess" "periodic_lowess". latter allows one fit closed curves. Beware, may want use iter = 0 lowess(). approx_points Approximate curve smoothing reduce computational time. FALSE, approximation curve occurs. Otherwise, approx_points must equal number points curve gets approximated ; preferably 100. trace TRUE, iteration information printed plot_iterations TRUE iterations plotted. ... additional arguments smoothers s parametrized curve, represented polygon.

title: Fit a Principal Curve — principal_curve
text: object class "principal_curve" returned. object   following generic methods currently available: plot, points, lines. components: s matrix corresponding x, giving projections       onto curve. ord index, s[order, ] smooth. lambda point, arc-length beginning     curve. curve parametrized approximately arc-length,     hence unit-speed. dist sum--squared distances points     projections. converged logical indicating whether algorithm converged     . num_iterations Number iterations completed returning. call call created object; allows     updated().

title: Fit a Principal Curve — principal_curve
text: Hastie, T. Stuetzle, W.,  Principal Curves,  JASA, Vol. 84, . 406 (Jun., 1989), pp. 502-516,  doi:10.2307/2289936   (PDF).

title: Fit a Principal Curve — principal_curve
code: x <- runif(100,-1,1) x <- cbind(x, x ^ 2 + rnorm(100, sd = 0.1)) fit <- principal_curve(x) plot(fit) lines(fit) points(fit) whiskers(x, fit$s)

what: Project a set of points to the closest point on a curve — project_to_curve
title: Project a set of points to the closest point on a curve — project_to_curve
text: Finds projection index matrix points x, projected onto curve s. curve need length number points.

title: Project a set of points to the closest point on a curve — project_to_curve
Project a set of points to the closest point on a curve — project_to_curve
text: x matrix data points. s parametrized curve, represented polygon. stretch stretch factor endpoints curve, allowing curve grow avoid bunching end. Must numeric value 0 2.

title: Project a set of points to the closest point on a curve — project_to_curve
text: structure returned represents fitted curve.  components s fitted points curve corresponding point x ord order fitted points lambda projection index point dist total squared distance curve dist_ind squared distances curve respective points

title: Project a set of points to the closest point on a curve — project_to_curve
code: t <- runif(100, -1, 1) x <- cbind(t, t ^ 2) + rnorm(200, sd = 0.05) s <- matrix(c(-1, 0, 1, 1, 0, 1), ncol = 2)  proj <- project_to_curve(x, s)  plot(x) lines(s) segments(x[, 1], x[, 2], proj$s[, 1], proj$s[, 2])

title: Smoother functions — smoother_functions
text: functions interface function(lambda, xj, ...), return smoothed values xj. output expected ordered along ordered lambda. means following true:
code: x <- runif(100) y <- runif(100) ord <- sample.int(100) sfun <- smoother_functions[[1]] all(sfun(x, y) == sfun(x[ord], y[ord]))

title: Smoother functions — smoother_functions
text: object class list length 3.

title: Generate circle as initial curve — start_circle
Generate circle as initial curve — start_circle
text: x data generate initial circle

title: Generate circle as initial curve — start_circle
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ x <- cbind(   rnorm(100, 1, .2),   rnorm(100, -5, .2),   runif(100, 1.9, 2.1),   runif(100, 2.9, 3.1) ) circ <- start_circle(x) plot(x) lines(circ) } # }

title: princurve 2.1.6 (2021-01-17)
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-18 BUG FIX project_to_curve(): Return error message x s contain insufficient rows. BUG FIX unit tests: Switch svg() pdf() support svg() might optional.

title: princurve 2.1.5 (2020-08-13)
text: CRAN release: 2020-08-25 BUG FIX project_to_curve(): Fix pass--reference bug, issue #33. Thanks @szcf-weiya detecting fixing bug!

title: princurve 2.1.4 (2019-05-29)
text: CRAN release: 2019-05-29 BUG FIX: Fix warning stats::approx() due changes made R 3.6. DEFUNCT principal.curve() get.lam().

title: princurve 2.1.3 (2018-09-10)
text: CRAN release: 2018-10-08 BUG FIX: Removed extra dependencies princurve removing vignettes; fixes #28. DEPRECATION principal.curve() get.lam().

title: princurve 2.1.2 (2018-07-24)
text: CRAN release: 2018-07-24 DOCUMENTATION: Use magick package generate animated GIFs vignette, instead animation package, animation uses ffmpeg installed CRAN systems. DEPRECATION: Added deprecation triggered starting 2018-08-01 upon calling principal.curve() get.lam().

title: princurve 2.1.1 (2018-07-23)
text: CRAN release: 2018-07-23 DOCUMENTATION: Added vignettes algorithm behind princurve benchmarking results princurve 1.1 2.1. BUG FIX principal_curve(): Don’t apply rownames curve approx_points set different value nrow(x). TESTING: Skip comparison unit test princurve 1.1 2.1 CRAN. MINOR CHANGE project_to_curve(): Attempt fix rchk warnings using x(, j) = v notation instead x[j * x.nrow() + ] = v. DOCUMENTATION: Fix README documentation.

title: princurve 2.1.0 (2018-07-14)
text: CRAN release: 2018-07-14 BUG FIX principal_curve(): avoid division zero initial principal curve already converged. BUG FIX project_to_curve(): set dimension names outputted s correctly. DOCUMENTATION: Added cran-comments.md revdep repository. MINOR CHANGE: Removed adjust_range(); use grDevices::extendrange() instead. TESTING start_circle(): Added unit tests. BUG FIX start_circle(): Make sure circle centered scaled correctly. MINOR CHANGE: Move smoother functions inside principal_curve() list smoother_functions. TESTING smoother_functions: Added tests ensure smoother functions work correctly. SPEED project_to_curve(): Significantly speed function allocation objects don’t need allocation, pre-allocating objects . SPEED principal_curve(): Added approx_points parameter. allows approximation curve smoothing projection, ensure principal_curve() scales well higher numbers samples.

title: princurve 2.0.4 (2018-07-09)
text: CRAN release: 2018-07-09 BUG FIX: Fixed issues legacy principal.curve() get.lam() (#8). TESTING: Perform direct comparison current princurve princurve 1.1-12 check whether principal.curve() get.lam() produce output exactly format almost exactly values. SIGNIFICANT CHANGE: Remove ord parameter project_to_curve(), order reduce amount Rcpp code little bit. DOCUMENTATION: Improved citations (#10). DOCUMENTATION: Improved news (#11). SPEED project_to_curve(): compute lambda accurately used order points x. MINOR CHANGE: Added ... argument whiskers(). DOCUMENTATION: Minor fix output documentation principal_curve(). DOCUMENTATION: Added information README. MINOR CHANGE: Support news() markdown news GitHub.

title: princurve 2.0.3 (2018-07-04)
text: CRAN release: 2018-07-04 SIGNIFICANT CHANGES: Reimplemented project_to_curve() completely Rcpp, thereby completely removing Fortran code princurve. TESTING: test linux osx. TESTING: Added tests ensure project_to_curve() works similar legacy get.lam().

title: princurve 2.0.2 (2018-06-12)
text: CRAN release: 2018-06-12 MAINTAINER: Changed maintainer Andreas Weingessel Robrecht Cannoodt. SIGNIFICANT CHANGES: Added functions principal_curve() project_to_curve() slightly different interface principal.curve() get.lam(). DEPRECATION: Prepare get.lam() principal.curve() deprecation planned 2018-07-01. contact maintainers reverse depending packages. BUG FIX: Allow start_circle() work number dimensions larger 2. DOCUMENTATION: Rewrite README markdown. DOCUMENTATION: Use roxygen2 documentation. MINOR CHANGES: Clean code ensure consistent code formatting. TESTING: Added tests principal_curve() project_to_curve(). TESTING: Enabled continuous integration using travis-ci.org ci.appveyor.com.

title: princurve 1.1-12 (2013-04-25)
text: CRAN release: 2013-04-25 BUG FIX: src/sortdi.f (sortdi): Fix Fortran array bounds problem.

title: princurve 1.1-11 (2011-09-18)
text: CRAN release: 2011-09-18 MINOR CHANGES: Update R 2.0. DEPRECATION: Removed whiskers()

title: princurve 1.1-10 (2009-10-04)
text: CRAN release: 2009-10-04 BENCHMARKING: larger data sets, time spent get.lam(). BUG FIX: smooth.spline(x,y) use return values “unique” {x}:s. means fitted {y}:s maybe fewer input vector. order control , use predict(). NEW FEATURE: Now smoother can also function taking arguments lambda, xj ... return y length lambda xj. NEW FEATURE principal.curve(): Arguments start stretch can NULL, behaves “missing” [hard emulate instance .call()]. NEW FEATURE: Added converged nbrOfIterations return structure. SPEED /MEMORY OPTIMIZATION: Now nxp matrix ‘s’ allocated . built using cbind() per iteration. SPEED : Now smoother function identified/created starting algorithm, per dimension iteration. MEMORY OPTIMISATION principal.curve(): Now result matrix allocated doubles, logicals (NA ), order prevent coersion. BUG FIX: error thrown smoother function. MINOR CHANGES: Cleaned source code (removed comments).

title: princurve 1.1-9 (2007-07-12)
text: CRAN release: 2007-07-13 MINOR CHANGE: Clarify license.

title: princurve 1.1-8 (2006-10-04)

title: princurve 1.1-0 (2000-12-27)
text: CRAN release: 2000-12-27 DESCRIPTION: Added Title Maintainer field. MINOR CHANGES: Changed F FALSE. DOCUMENTATION: Added keywords get.lam(). DOCUMENTATION: Expanded documentation principal.curve(): added default values usage, description, keywords aliases. MINOR CHANGES: Changed precision getlam.f v(2,10) v(2,p).
